a3

Class Investment

  • java.lang.Object
    • a3.Investment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MutualFund, Stock

    public abstract class Investment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the super class for stocks and mutual funds

    • Constructor Detail

      • Investment

        public Investment(java.lang.String type,
                  java.lang.String symbol,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  int quantity,
                  double price)
           throws EmptyFieldException,
                  LessThanZeroException
        Constructor to make a new investment with a given type
        Parameters:
        type - The type of investment (stock or mutual fund)
        symbol - The unique symbol representing the stock
        name - Name of stock
        quantity - The quantity initially purchased
        price - The price per share at time of purchase
        Throws:
        EmptyFieldException - Exception thrown when a field is empty
        LessThanZeroException - Exception that is thrown when a field is less than zero

    • Method Detail

      • updateBuy

        public double updateBuy(int quantity,
                        double price)
        Update the values of the investment after a purchase
        Parameters:
        quantity - The number of stocks purchased
        price - The price per stock
        Returns:
        The cost of purchase

      • updateSell

        public double updateSell(int quantity,
                         double price)
        Updates the values of a stock or mutual fund after sell
        Parameters:
        quantity - The quantity of shares sold
        price - The price per share sold
        Returns:
        Returns the payment received for the sale

      • getGain

        public static double getGain(Investment i)
        Get the gain of an investment
        Parameters:
        i - The investment being used to calculate the gain
        Returns:
        Return the gain, or 0 if the investment is neither a mutual fund or a stock
